<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COMMUNICATIONS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/14/zoom-rolls-virtual-ticketed-events-thirdparty-app-integrations?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Zoom Call Is the New Will Call
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Ticket booth with Zoom call instead of teller" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzkwL3pvb21fdGlja2V0X2Jvb3RoLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba<em> </em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like your dorm room when your roommate’s high school friends are in town, Zoom has been tasked with hosting way more than it bargained for. During the pandemic, everything from weddings to concerts made the transition from IRL to Zoom, so yesterday the company doubled down on its newfound identity.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Tickets, please </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Zoom is getting into <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/14/zoom-launches-onzoom-paid-live-events.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">online ticketed events</a> with a new platform called OnZoom. Event hosts will have a wider range of tools available and, most importantly, they’ll be able to charge for events. Consumers can use OnZoom to browse classes, concerts, and workshops to attend.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">It’s got some competition: </strong></span><span>Live Nation, EventBrite, and other platforms that make money by taking a cut of ticket sales have also invested heavily in virtual events in the past few months. Zoom is initially holding off on monetizing in a similar manner, but did say it would take a portion of event sales down the road.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">OnZoom will also be competing with Airbnb's “experiences.” Since 2016, the house-sharing giant has offered services that match visitors with activities, like tours or cooking classes, while traveling. But after those offerings shifted online early in the pandemic, <a href="https://www.engadget.com/airbnb-online-experiences-170103711.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most of them to Zoom</a>, consumers might decide to skip Airbnb altogether in favor of OnZoom if the platform’s curation is up to snuff.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But Zoom can play nice with others, too</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, it also announced plans to allow <a href="https://venturebeat.com/2020/10/14/zoom-launches-zapps-to-bring-third-party-apps-into-video-calls/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">third-party apps</a> to run on its platform. Zoom has certainly scratched an itch for many businesses adapting to the new normal, but it thinks more hands = better scratching. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Enter “Zapps,” </strong></span><span>app offerings from the likes of Salesforce and Slack that can integrate directly into Zoom’s software. Zoom wants these Zapps to facilitate the sharing of ideas and generally enhance the core video experience that propelled its meteoric rise. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Zoom has entered attack mode, working to strengthen its grip on the massive audience it was gifted by the pandemic. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/14/coronavirus-restrictions-reimplemented-across-european-countries?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Europe Rides a Second Wave
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A woman crosses the street in Belfast, Northern Ireland " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzg5L2JlbGZhc3QuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Charles McQuillan/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This week, Europe’s daily rolling average of Covid-19 infections reached 78,000, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/europe-overtakes-u-s-in-new-cases-of-covid-as-restrictions-tighten-11602669748?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surpassing</a> the U.S. To tamp down the spike, governments are implementing new curbs on everyday life. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">French president </strong><strong style="color:#000">Emmanuel Macron</strong> declared a state of emergency and <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-14/macron-to-impose-curfew-for-major-french-cities-to-stem-covid?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">instituted</a> a curfew (9pm to 6am) for the country’s biggest cities—affecting nearly a third of the population. Economists say prolonged restrictions could shove the country back into the recession it experienced in the spring. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Northern Ireland</strong> is <a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/covid-second-wave-europe-lockdowns/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">closing</a> pubs and restaurants for all but takeout, plus schools and many other businesses. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The UK</strong> closed bars and pubs in its most heavily affected areas. Prime Minister Boris Johnson is facing attacks for what critics call uncertainty and confusion caused by the government’s three-tiered lockdown system. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The Netherlands</strong> will partially lock down for at least four weeks. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Cristiano Ronaldo,</strong> the soccer megastar, tested <a href="https://www.espn.com/soccer/portugal-por/story/4207168/cristiano-ronaldo-tests-positive-for-coronavirusleaves-portugal-squad?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">positive</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>European leaders are desperately trying to avoid full lockdowns like they implemented in the spring, but a second wave is backing them into a corner. </p>

<img alt="Nick Saban" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzkyL25pY2tfc2FiYW4uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Kent Gidley/Collegiate Images/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nick Saban, head coach of the No. 2 ranked Alabama football team, has <a href="https://www.espn.com/college-football/story/_/id/30116627/alabama-football-coach-nick-saban-tests-positive-covid-19-sources-say?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tested positive</a> for Covid-19, the school announced yesterday. He's self-isolating at home while offensive coordinator Steve Sarkisian takes the reins ahead of the team's matchup with No. 3 Georgia on Saturday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The news comes while another SEC school, Florida, is dealing with its own outbreak. After 19 Gators tested positive, it <a href="https://www.wesh.com/article/florida-gators-lsu-postponed-football-covid-19/34373337?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suspended</a> football activities and postponed its game with LSU.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Big-name schools like Alabama and Florida were desperate to start their seasons and capture some of the revenue generated by their football programs. They'll hope this is a blip, not a trend. </p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<img alt="Slack" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMTMwMi8xNjAyMTgzMzk3LTE2MDEzMTQ4MDctcHJlc2VudGVkX2J5XzE1MDB4ODUwX2F1YmVyZ2luZV8yeC5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJjb21ldC1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>The following is a transcript of a conversation in #brewcrew, the </em><em>Slack channel</em><em> Morning Brew uses to discuss IMPORTANT company-wide stuff.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Henry, Copywriter:</em> This <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N32602.3407870MORNINGBREW/B24449302.282930726;dc_trk_aid=476762230;dc_trk_cid=137781263;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;gdpr=%24{GDPR};gdpr_consent=%24{GDPR_CONSENT_755}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Slack channel</a> makes it so <strong style="color:#000">easy to communicate with the whole team</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Blake, Creative Director:</em> Can you imagine if we all had to email?! <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N32602.3407870MORNINGBREW/B24449302.282930726;dc_trk_aid=476762230;dc_trk_cid=137781263;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;gdpr=%24{GDPR};gdpr_consent=%24{GDPR_CONSENT_755}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Slack channels</a> are <strong style="color:#000">so much faster, better organized, and secure</strong>!</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Sasha, Brand Partner:</em> That’s what I was gonna say, Slack is basically our company HQ, especially now that I’m in Rancho Cucamonga and Sydney's visiting her Polish grandma.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Sydney, yet another Copywriter:</em> She’s called a Babcia.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Alessandra, Integrated Marketing:</em><strong style="color:#000"> </strong>Well tell your grandma that Slack lets you <strong style="color:#000">access info from thousands of apps, files, and make calls</strong> all within <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N32602.3407870MORNINGBREW/B24449302.282930726;dc_trk_aid=476762230;dc_trk_cid=137781263;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;gdpr=%24{GDPR};gdpr_consent=%24{GDPR_CONSENT_755}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">THIS OR ANY OTHER CHANNEL</a>!</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Neal, Managing Editor:</em><strong style="color:#000"> </strong>Are u guys trying to turn our Slack into an ad?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Henry, Copywriter:</em><strong style="color:#000"> </strong>What? No, we’re just saying, <strong style="color:#000">Slack is where work happens</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Neal, Managing Editor:</em> This is def an ad.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Henry, Copywriter:</em><strong style="color:#000"> </strong>If this was an ad, then at the end, wouldn’t I tell you to <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N32602.3407870MORNINGBREW/B24449302.282930726;dc_trk_aid=476762230;dc_trk_cid=137781263;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;gdpr=%24{GDPR};gdpr_consent=%24{GDPR_CONSENT_755}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">click here to learn more about how Slack is the new digital headquarters???</a></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Facebook and Twitter <a href="https://www.cnet.com/news/facebook-twitter-limit-reach-of-new-york-post-article-about-hunter-biden/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">decided to limit</a> the distribution of a New York Post story about Joe Biden out of concern that it might be misinformation, sparking outcry from conservative lawmakers and raising questions around their content moderation policies. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Post's story alleges then-Vice President Biden’s son Hunter Biden attempted to make introductions between his father and an exec at a Ukrainian company. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Post claims it obtained “smoking gun” emails, but the platforms had questions around the authenticity of the story. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The two companies made the same decision, but for different reasons. Twitter <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/10/14/21515972/facebook-new-york-post-hunter-biden-story-fact-checking-reduced-distribution-election-misinformation?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cited</a> its policy against distributing hacked material, while Facebook said the story is “eligible to be fact checked” by third-party partners and will be curtailed until it’s been vetted. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Facebook has long refused to be an “arbiter of truth”—but it seems to be arbiting something here. President Trump <a href="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1316501350658707456?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">attacked</a> both companies in a tweet last night, calling their actions "so terrible." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Later in the evening, Twitter explained its reasoning a bit more, saying it was the <em>images</em> in the article that violated its hacked material rules. CEO Jack Dorsey said the company's decision to block URL sharing without context was "unacceptable."  </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REAL ESTATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/14/wework-founder-adam-neumann-invests-real-estate-startup-alfred?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
He's Back
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Adam Neumann" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzg4L2FkYW1fbmV1bWFubi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Kelly Sullivan/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Former WeWork CEO Adam Neumann and his luscious locks have returned to the biz world. Real estate startup Alfred <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/wework-adam-neumann-returns-real-161707928.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> yesterday that Neumann’s family investment office led its most recent $42 million round. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Alfred offers services to apartment buildings, such as dog walking and rent processing. It’s operating in over 100,000 apartments and has almost $100 million in the bank.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>WeWork’s implosion was <em>the</em> business news story of 2019. A little over a year ago, the startup <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/we-company-changes-name-wework-coworking-startup-2020-10?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed to go public</a> at a jaw-dropping $47 billion valuation...but in doing so, opened its books to reveal fishy governance and fishier accounting. The IPO was scrapped, as was Neumann, and the company is now valued at $2.9 billion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Speaking of...</strong>WeWork’s parent company, The We Company, said yesterday it will return to the “WeWork” name, a symbolic nod to its office-rental roots. Like much of commercial real estate, WeWork was crushed during the pandemic, with huge vacancies leading to mass layoffs. It’s still bleeding cash, but CEO Sandeep Mathrani <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-property-wework-namechange-exclus/exclusive-the-we-company-drops-we-name-to-restore-wework-as-companys-official-name-idUSKBN26Z2DR?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> it will turn a profit by the end of next year.</p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nCOMMUNICATIONS\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/14/zoom-rolls-virtual-ticketed-events-thirdparty-app-integrations?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nZoom Call Is the New Will Call\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Ticket booth with Zoom call instead of teller\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzkwL3pvb21fdGlja2V0X2Jvb3RoLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLike your dorm room when your roommate’s high school friends are in town, Zoom has been tasked with hosting way more than it bargained for. During the pandemic, everything from weddings to concerts made the transition from IRL to Zoom, so yesterday the company doubled down on its newfound identity.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTickets, please \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eZoom is getting into \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/14/zoom-launches-onzoom-paid-live-events.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eonline ticketed events\u003c/a\u003e with a new platform called OnZoom. Event hosts will have a wider range of tools available and, most importantly, they’ll be able to charge for events. Consumers can use OnZoom to browse classes, concerts, and workshops to attend.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’s got some competition: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLive Nation, EventBrite, and other platforms that make money by taking a cut of ticket sales have also invested heavily in virtual events in the past few months. Zoom is initially holding off on monetizing in a similar manner, but did say it would take a portion of event sales down the road.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOnZoom will also be competing with Airbnb's “experiences.” Since 2016, the house-sharing giant has offered services that match visitors with activities, like tours or cooking classes, while traveling. But after those offerings shifted online early in the pandemic, \u003ca href=\"https://www.engadget.com/airbnb-online-experiences-170103711.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emost of them to Zoom\u003c/a\u003e, consumers might decide to skip Airbnb altogether in favor of OnZoom if the platform’s curation is up to snuff.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut Zoom can play nice with others, too\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, it also announced plans to allow \u003ca href=\"https://venturebeat.com/2020/10/14/zoom-launches-zapps-to-bring-third-party-apps-into-video-calls/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethird-party apps\u003c/a\u003e to run on its platform. Zoom has certainly scratched an itch for many businesses adapting to the new normal, but it thinks more hands = better scratching. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEnter “Zapps,” \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eapp offerings from the likes of Salesforce and Slack that can integrate directly into Zoom’s software. Zoom wants these Zapps to facilitate the sharing of ideas and generally enhance the core video experience that propelled its meteoric rise. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eZoom has entered attack mode, working to strengthen its grip on the massive audience it was gifted by the pandemic. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eCharles McQuillan/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis week, Europe’s daily rolling average of Covid-19 infections reached 78,000, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/europe-overtakes-u-s-in-new-cases-of-covid-as-restrictions-tighten-11602669748?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurpassing\u003c/a\u003e the U.S. To tamp down the spike, governments are implementing new curbs on everyday life. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFrench president \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEmmanuel Macron\u003c/strong\u003e declared a state of emergency and \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-14/macron-to-impose-curfew-for-major-french-cities-to-stem-covid?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einstituted\u003c/a\u003e a curfew (9pm to 6am) for the country’s biggest cities—affecting nearly a third of the population. Economists say prolonged restrictions could shove the country back into the recession it experienced in the spring. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNorthern Ireland\u003c/strong\u003e is \u003ca href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/covid-second-wave-europe-lockdowns/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclosing\u003c/a\u003e pubs and restaurants for all but takeout, plus schools and many other businesses. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe UK\u003c/strong\u003e closed bars and pubs in its most heavily affected areas. Prime Minister Boris Johnson is facing attacks for what critics call uncertainty and confusion caused by the government’s three-tiered lockdown system. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe Netherlands\u003c/strong\u003e will partially lock down for at least four weeks. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCristiano Ronaldo,\u003c/strong\u003e the soccer megastar, tested \u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/soccer/portugal-por/story/4207168/cristiano-ronaldo-tests-positive-for-coronavirusleaves-portugal-squad?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epositive\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eEuropean leaders are desperately trying to avoid full lockdowns like they implemented in the spring, but a second wave is backing them into a corner. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F10%2F14%2Fcoronavirus-restrictions-reimplemented-across-european-countries\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nTwitter, Facebook Draw Heat for Limiting Biden Story\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Facebook and Twitter \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnet.com/news/facebook-twitter-limit-reach-of-new-york-post-article-about-hunter-biden/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edecided to limit\u003c/a\u003e the distribution of a New York Post story about Joe Biden out of concern that it might be misinformation, sparking outcry from conservative lawmakers and raising questions around their content moderation policies. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Post's story alleges then-Vice President Biden’s son Hunter Biden attempted to make introductions between his father and an exec at a Ukrainian company. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Post claims it obtained “smoking gun” emails, but the platforms had questions around the authenticity of the story. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe two companies made the same decision, but for different reasons. Twitter \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/10/14/21515972/facebook-new-york-post-hunter-biden-story-fact-checking-reduced-distribution-election-misinformation?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecited\u003c/a\u003e its policy against distributing hacked material, while Facebook said the story is “eligible to be fact checked” by third-party partners and will be curtailed until it’s been vetted. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Facebook has long refused to be an “arbiter of truth”—but it seems to be arbiting something here. President Trump \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1316501350658707456?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eattacked\u003c/a\u003e both companies in a tweet last night, calling their actions \"so terrible.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLater in the evening, Twitter explained its reasoning a bit more, saying it was the \u003cem\u003eimages\u003c/em\u003e in the article that violated its hacked material rules. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFormer WeWork CEO Adam Neumann and his luscious locks have returned to the biz world. Real estate startup Alfred \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/wework-adam-neumann-returns-real-161707928.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e yesterday that Neumann’s family investment office led its most recent $42 million round. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAlfred offers services to apartment buildings, such as dog walking and rent processing. It’s operating in over 100,000 apartments and has almost $100 million in the bank.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eWeWork’s implosion was \u003cem\u003ethe\u003c/em\u003e business news story of 2019. A little over a year ago, the startup \u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/we-company-changes-name-wework-coworking-startup-2020-10?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiled to go public\u003c/a\u003e at a jaw-dropping $47 billion valuation...but in doing so, opened its books to reveal fishy governance and fishier accounting. The IPO was scrapped, as was Neumann, and the company is now valued at $2.9 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSpeaking of...\u003c/strong\u003eWeWork’s parent company, The We Company, said yesterday it will return to the “WeWork” name, a symbolic nod to its office-rental roots. Like much of commercial real estate, WeWork was crushed during the pandemic, with huge vacancies leading to mass layoffs. It’s still bleeding cash, but CEO Sandeep Mathrani \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-property-wework-namechange-exclus/exclusive-the-we-company-drops-we-name-to-restore-wework-as-companys-official-name-idUSKBN26Z2DR?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e it will turn a profit by the end of next
